questions.text: Ciliary muscles are embryologically derived from:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Neural Crest Ciliary muscles are embryologically derived from Neural crest. Neural Crest derivative Trabecular meshwork Orbit: bony and connective tissue Ciliary muscle Sclera, all except the temporal part Corneal stroma and endothelium

Highyeild:

Derivatives of surface ectoderm Lens Epithelial lining of lids, conjunctiva, cornea, lacrimal apparatus Lacrimal gland Derivatives of neuroectoderm Retina Optic nerve Secondary and tertiary vitreous Epithelial lining of the iris and ciliary body Smooth muscle of the iris Derivatives of mesoderm Primary vitreous Extraocular muscle Choroid Temporal part of sclera Stroma Vascular endothelium of eye and orbit Neural Crest derivative Trabecular meshwork Orbit: bony and connective tissue Ciliary muscle Sclera, all except the temporal part Corneal stroma and endothelium

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option:A. neural ectoderm derivatives Retina Optic nerve Secondary and tertiary vitreous Epithelial lining of the iris and ciliary body Smooth muscle of the iris Option:B. mesoderm Derivatives of mesoderm Primary vitreous Extraocular muscle Choroid Temporal part of sclera Stroma Vascular endothelium of eye and orbit Option:C. Surface ectoderm Derivatives of surface ectoderm Lens Epithelial lining of lids, conjunctiva, cornea, lacrimal apparatus Lacrimal gland

questions.text: An MBBS student in his university practical exams was asked to recognize the parts labelled in the given image of initial stages of eye development. Match the following images with the corresponding options. Cavity of the forebrain. Cavity of theOptic Vesicle. Cavity of the Optic Cup. Neural Ectoderm Select the correct answer from the given below ciode:

options.label: A
options.text: a - IV, b - III, c - I, d - II

options.label: B
options.text: a - IV, b - II, c - I, d - III

options.label: C
options.text: a - I, b - III, c - IV, d - II

options.label: D
options.text: a - I, b - II, c - III, d – IV

questions.correct_answer: C. a - I, b - III, c - IV, d - II
questions.explanation:
Solution:

a - I, b - III, c - IV, d - II The above images shows the following: A-Forebrain Transverse Cut Section B- Primary Optic Vesicle C-Optic Cup Formation D- Optic Cup & Lens Vesicle E-Ciliary and Iris Formation F- Complete Development of Eye

questions.text: A newly pregnant couple is anxious about the development of their newborn in the womb. Which of the following is correct regarding the first milestone of eye development and its time?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

3 weeks - Optic groove appears The first major milestone in the development of the eye is the appearance of the optic groove. It starts in the third week after conception.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . 2 weeks: optic groove appears: appearance of the optic groove. It starts in the third week after conception. Option: C . 3 weeks: Lens plate forms: by the 4th week. Option: D . 2 weeks: Lens plate forms: by the 4th week.
